body_html:
Interesting, thanks. So the issue is that the default non-monolithic build omits a protocol buffer implementation (it lives in libtensorflow_framework.so), which is then supplied by Android, and the version doesn't necessarily match.

If that's correct, then adding "@protobuf_archive//:protobuf" as a dep for the build target would also fix this (i.e. would statically include a protocol buffer implementation which matches the header version). It would be important that libtensorflow_framework.so not be linked in (should be true for Android anyway), since multiple protocol buffer implementations will cause issues.
body_text:

If that's correct, then adding "@protobuf_archive//:protobuf" as a dep for the build target would also fix this (i.e. would statically include a protocol buffer implementation which matches the header version). It would be important that libtensorflow_framework.so not be linked in (should be true for Android anyway), since multiple protocol buffer implementations will cause issues.
body:
Interesting, thanks. So the issue is that the default non-monolithic build omits a protocol buffer implementation (it lives in libtensorflow_framework.so), which is then supplied by Android, and the version doesn't necessarily match.

If that's correct, then adding "@protobuf_archive//:protobuf" as a dep for the build target would also fix this (i.e. would statically include a protocol buffer implementation which matches the header version). It would be important that libtensorflow_framework.so *not* be linked in (should be true for Android anyway), since multiple protocol buffer implementations will cause issues.
